schemaMeta.comments: The Internet Addictions Data Commons (IADC) database for IUâ€™s Addictions Grand Challenge

table.name: PILL_IN
table.comments: DEA Pill Purchase Data in Indiana

column.name: REPORTER_BUS_ACT
column.comments: Business activity of reporter

column.name: REPORTER_NAME
column.comments: Name of reporter

column.name: REPORTER_STATE
column.comments: State of reporter

column.name: REPORTER_COUNTY
column.comments: County of reporter

column.name: BUYER_BUS_ACT
column.comments: Business activity of buyer

column.name: BUYER_NAME
column.comments: Name of buyer

column.name: BUYER_STATE
column.comments: State of buyer

column.name: BUYER_COUNTY
column.comments: County of buyer

column.name: NDC_NO
column.comments: The National Drug Code (NDC) used by ARCOS is an 11-character code that identifies controlled substance products. This code is divided into three segments: the labeler code, the product code, and the package size code. General specifications are presented in Section 5.10.2, Specifications: NDC, followed by detailed specifications for each segment.

column.name: DRUG_NAME
column.comments: Drug name assigned by labeler

column.name: QUANTITY
column.comments: The quantity field is a numeric field containing the number of packages, weight, or volume being reported.

column.name: TRANSACTION_DATE
column.comments: The transaction date is the actual date on which a reportable activity occurred.

column.name: CALC_BASE_WT_IN_GM
column.comments: DEA calculated gram equivalent of active ingredient in shipment

column.name: INGREDIENT_NAME
column.comments: Ingrediant Name

column.name: MME_CONVERSION_FACTOR
column.comments: Morphine Milligram Equivalents conversion factor

column.name: COMBINED_LABELER_NAME
column.comments: Labeler name

column.name: REVISED_COMPANY_NAME
column.comments: Revised Company Name

column.name: REPORTER_FAMILY
column.comments: Reporter Organization Name

column.name: DOS_STR
column.comments: Total milligrams of opioid ingrediant per pill

column.name: BUYER_TRACT_5
column.comments: First 5 digits of census tract of buyer

table.name: ACS
table.comments: Census Tract Level Social Determinants from ACS 5-Year Estimates

column.name: GEOGRAPHY_NAME
column.comments: Plaintext geography name

column.name: TRACT_11
column.comments: 11 digit census tract

column.name: YEAR
column.comments: Year of estimate, e.g 2017 means 2013-2017 5 year estimate

column.name: TOTAL_FEMALE
column.comments: Total female population, from census table B01001

column.name: TOTAL_MALE
column.comments: Total male population, from census table B01001

column.name: MEDIAN_AGE
column.comments: Median age, from census table B01002

column.name: TOTAL_POPULATION
column.comments: Total population, from census table B01001

column.name: TOTAL_HOUSEHOLDS
column.comments: Total household, from census trable B00002

column.name: CASH_ASSISTANCE_OR_SNAP
column.comments: Total with SNAP, from census table B09010

column.name: NOT_IN_LABOR_FORCE
column.comments: Total not in labor force, from census table B10058

column.name: INCOME_BELOW_POVERTY_12MONTH
column.comments: Below poverty level in past 12 month, from census table B14006

column.name: INCOME_ABOVE_POVERTY_12MONTH
column.comments: Above poverty level in past 12 month, from census table B14006

column.name: INCOME_U10K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_10K_15K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_15K_20K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_20K_25K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_25K_30K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_30K_35K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_35K_40K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_40K_50K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_45K_50K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_50K_60K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_60K_75K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_75K_100K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_100K_125K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_125K_150K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_150K_200K
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: INCOME_200KO
column.comments: Income bracket from census table B19001

column.name: TRACT_5
column.comments: First 5 digits of TRACT_11, represents just state and county

table.name: EMS
table.comments: De-identified county level EMS run data from MPH

column.name: INC_INCIDENTID
column.comments: Incident ID direct from EMS data. There might be multiple rows with the same incident ID due to different MEDICATION_GIVEN values

column.name: INC_INCIDENTDATE
column.comments: Date of EMS incident

column.name: NARCANRUN
column.comments: Was Narcan given during this EMS run?

column.name: SIT_PROVIDER_PRIM_IMPRESSION
column.comments: Primary impression/diagnosis by EMS provider.

column.name: SIT_PRIMARYSYMPTOM
column.comments: Patient's primary sympton requiring EMS services.

column.name: MEDICATION_GIVEN
column.comments: The medication given to the patient

column.name: DRUGUSEINDICATORS
column.comments: Any drug use by patient

column.name: INC_TRACT_5
column.comments: 5 digit state and fips code where incident occurred.

column.name: INC_CITY
column.comments: City where incident occurred

column.name: INC_ZIP
column.comments: Zip code where incident occurred

column.name: EMS_PROVIDER_TRACT_5
column.comments: 5 digit state and fips code of EMS provider location

column.name: EMS_PROVIDER_CITY
column.comments: City of EMS provider

column.name: EMS_PROVIDER_ZIP
column.comments: Zip code of ems provider

column.name: PAT_TRACT_5
column.comments: 5 digit state and fips code of patient's home address

column.name: PAT_CITY
column.comments: City of patient's home address

column.name: PAT_ZIP
column.comments: Zip code of patient's home address

table.name: TRACT_MAP
table.comments: Maps Indiana census tracts to county names

column.name: TRACT_11
column.comments: 11 digit census tract code. Digits 1-2 are a state code, digits 3-5 are a county FIPS code, and digits 6-11 represent a census tract

column.name: TRACT_5
column.comments: Digits 1-5 of TRACT_11, representing a county

column.name: COUNTY
column.comments: County associated with TRACT_5

column.name: TRACT_5
column.comments: 5 digit state and fips code of the county

column.name: INPC_POPULATION
column.comments: Number of unique INPC patients with a home address in the county

column.name: TOTAL_POPULATION
column.comments: Total population of county per ACS 2017 5-year estimates

column.name: INPC_COVERAGE_PCT
column.comments: INPC_POPULATION divided by TOTAL_POPULATION

column.name: STUDY_ID
column.comments: Unique patient identifier for linking to other clinical data

column.name: OPIOID_FILL_INDEX_DATE
column.comments: Date of first opioid fill in study period

column.name: AGE_AT_INDEX_FILL
column.comments: Age in years at OPIOID_FILL_INDEX_DATE

column.name: DATE_OF_BIRTH
column.comments: Date of birth of patient

column.name: GENDER
column.comments: Patient's gender (F=Female, M=Male, U=Unknown)

column.name: ETHNICITY
column.comments: Patient's ethnicity

column.name: RACE
column.comments: Patient's race

column.name: TRACT_11
column.comments: 11 digit census tract of patient's most recent home address

column.name: TRACT_UPDATE_DATE
column.comments: Most recent update date of TRACT_11 for this patient

column.name: ONE_PER_YEAR_FLAG
column.comments: If set to 1, indicates patient had a complete calender year with a single opioid fill

column.name: ONE_PER_YEAR_DATE
column.comments: Date of earliest qualifying opioid fill for ONE_PER_YEAR_FLAG

column.name: THREE_FILL_FLAG
column.comments: If set 1 to 1, inidcates patient had 3+ opioid fills within any 120 day period

column.name: THREE_FILL_DATE
column.comments: Date of earliest qualifying opiod fill for THREE_FILL_FLAG

column.name: STUDY_ID
column.comments: Unique patient identifier for linking to other clinical data

column.name: ENCOUNTER_ID
column.comments: Encounter ID for linkage with Encounter table

column.name: DX_DATE
column.comments: Date of diagnosis

column.name: DX_CODE
column.comments: Diagnosis Code

column.name: DX_CODE_SYSTEM
column.comments: Diagnosis Code System

column.name: DX_TEXT
column.comments: Diagnosis text/name

column.name: DX_CODE_TYPE
column.comments: Diagnosis type. See R2767 Codebooks folder for all codes that were searched for

column.name: STUDY_ID
column.comments: Unique patient identifier for linking to other clinical data

column.name: NDC_CODE
column.comments: 11 digit NDC Code that was filled

column.name: DRUG_NAME
column.comments: Named of drug that was filled

column.name: FILL_DATE
column.comments: Fill date

column.name: DISPENSE_AMOUNT
column.comments: Number of units dispensed at fill

column.name: NUMBER_OF_DAYS_SUPPLY
column.comments: Number of days supply

column.name: DRUG_TYPE
column.comments: Type of drug that was fill (AA = Anti Anxiety, AD = Antidepressant, NEURO = Neurlogical Agent, OPIOID = Opioid

column.name: STUDY_ID
column.comments: Unique patient identifier for linking to other clinical data

column.name: ENCOUNTER_ID
column.comments: Encounter ID for linking with diagnoses

column.name: ADMIT_TIME
column.comments: Date patient was admitted

column.name: DISCHARGE_TIME
column.comments: Date patient was discharged

column.name: COMMERCIAL_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: OTHERGOV_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if other government insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: SELFPAY_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if self pay was used at the encounter

column.name: WORKERSCOMP_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if wokers compensation was used at the encounter

column.name: INSTITUTIONALIZED_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if a institutionalized payment method was used at the encounter

column.name: CHARITY_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: MEDICARE_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: MEDICAID_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: LIFE_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: MDWISE_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: NODATA_FLAG
column.comments: Set to 1 if commerical insurance was used at the encounter

column.name: CARE_SETTING_CATEGORY
column.comments: Encounter type (E = Emergency, I = Inpatient, O = Outpatient)

column.name: OPIOID_OD
column.comments: Flag set to 1 if overdose phenotype detected an opioid overdose at this encounter

column.name: ANY_OD
column.comments: Flag set to 1 if any overdose phenotype detected at this encounter

column.name: STUDY_ID
column.comments: Unique patient identifier for linking to other clinical data

column.name: TEST_DATE
column.comments: Physiologic date of lab test

column.name: LAB_NAME
column.comments: Name of lab test

column.name: LAB_CODE_TYPE
column.comments: Lab Type

column.name: VALUE_TYPE
column.comments: Result value type (T = Text, N = Numeric)

column.name: LAB_VALUE
column.comments: Lab value. Numeric results may represent contain ranges, including symbols such as '>' and '<'
